alert.note: Alert for Bear Lake Valley; Bear River Range; Big Hole Mountains; Blackfoot Mountains; Caribou Range; Franklin, Eastern Oneida Region; Marsh and Arbon Highlands; Teton Valley (Idaho) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued January 10 at 4:51PM MST until January 13 at 11:00PM MST by NWS Pocatello
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WATCH IN EFFECT FROM THURSDAY EVENING THROUGH SATURDAY EVENING... ...WINTER STORM WARNING WILL EXPIRE AT 5 PM MST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Heavy snow and strong winds possible. 3 to 8 inches is possible in the valleys Friday with an additional 5 to 10 inches on Saturday. Above 7000 feet, accumulations up to 12 inches is possible Friday with an additional 10 to 20 inches on Saturday. Wind gusts to 50 mph are possible Friday with gusts to 30 mph Saturday. * WHERE...Inkom, McCammon, Downey, Lava Hot Springs, Malad, Preston, Thatcher, Emigration Summit, St. Charles, Montpelier, Georgetown, Grace, Soda Springs, Henry, Bone, Wayan, Swan Valley, Victor, Ashton, Tetonia, and Driggs. * WHEN...From Thursday evening through Saturday evening. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible. Widespread blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening commute.
info.instruction: Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation.
